medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began at birth with ambiguous genitalia and hyperpigmented scrotum. The infant presented with severe symptoms of lethargy and shock by 3 weeks of age, manifesting hyponatremia and hypoglycemia. Surgical interventions occurred at age 6 years.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of consanguineous marriage in family 1, highlighting a risk for autosomal recessive disorders. The patient in family 1 exhibited nonsalt-wasting 3bHSD deficiency diagnosed at age 2 years. The patient in family 2 had symptoms of salt-wasting 3bHSD deficiency and underwent phallic corporectomy and bilateral gonadectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Consanguineous marriage in family 1; no other family members reported with genital ambiguity or sudden death.
medical_history.social_history: Patient from family 1 born in Pakistan and patient from family 2 born in Taiwan; no other relevant social factors mentioned.
